title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Frederick S. Tukey to W. Storer How, April 16, 1866
summary: This letter from Frederick Tukey asks for intervention in what he perceives to be a case of injustice against a black plaintiff in a legal case. The attached wrappers trace the case's progress through the bureaucracy - it was decided not to intervene.
keywords: Legal System, Violence/Crime, Race Relations, American Civil War
